New Records: Canada recorded their first-ever win at an ICC Men's T20 World Cup
Key Match Events: Canada beat Ireland by 12 runs in a thrilling match at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium
Nicholas Kirton's 49 from 35 balls and Shreyas Movva's 37 from 36 were crucial for Canada's total
Jeremy Gordon and Dilon Heylinger took 2 wickets each for Canada
George Dockrell and Mark Adair's partnership almost saw Ireland pull off a sensational rescue job
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland won the toss and opted to bowl first
Canada were beaten by USA in the World Cup opener and were facing an uphill battle to qualify from a group that also contains India and Pakistan
Post-Match Reflections: Canada's win was their biggest result in history and a famous victory at the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024 in New York
Ireland were left disappointed by the nature of their loss and underperformed again at the same ground against Canada
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nicholas Kirton's impressive knock of 49 (35) against Ireland earns him the Aramco POTM award
